unnormalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood Box Office Blues & Biryani Breaks!**
normalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood Box Office Blues and Biryani Breaks!**

unnormalised: Bollywood's release calendar is hotter than a plate of Hyderabadi biryani during Onam! This week, we had three big banner flicks hitting the screens – a rom-com starring the perpetually youthful Anil Kapoor (seriously, what's his secret?), an action thriller shot entirely in Kashmir, and a biopic on a tabla maestro from Benaras.
normalised: Bollywood's release calendar is hotter than a plate of Hyderabadi biryani during Onam! This week, we had three big banner flicks hitting the screens – a rom-com starring the perpetually youthful Anil Kapoor (seriously, what's his secret?), an action thriller shot entirely in Kashmir, and a biopic on a tabla maestro from Benaras.

unnormalised: Early reports suggest audiences are, well, lukewarm. The rom-com is getting roasted for its predictable plot (apparently, love *still* conquers all). The Kashmir thriller has more plot holes than the moon. And the biopic? Let's just say it's inspiring people to take up the tabla... to drum up some excitement in their own lives.
normalised: Early reports suggest audiences are, well, lukewarm. The rom-com is getting roasted for its predictable plot (apparently, love *still* conquers all). The Kashmir thriller has more plot holes than the moon. And the biopic? Let's just say it's inspiring people to take up the tabla... to drum up some excitement in their own lives.

unnormalised: Industry analysts predict a combined opening weekend collection of... approximately Rs. 50 crores. Which, in Bollywood terms, is like finding a Rs. 10 note behind your sofa – nice, but not exactly life-changing.
normalised: Industry analysts predict a combined opening weekend collection of... approximately rupees fifty crore. Which, in Bollywood terms, is like finding a rupee ten note behind your sofa – nice, but not exactly life-changing.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, rumors are swirling that Karan Johar is planning a film about a chaiwala who accidentally becomes a millionaire. Sources say the climax involves a dramatic car chase through the streets of Chandni Chowk. We're betting it'll either be the biggest hit of the year or the biggest disaster since "Gunda". Stay tuned!
normalised: Meanwhile, rumors are swirling that Karan Johar is planning a film about a chaiwala who accidentally becomes a millionaire. Sources say the climax involves a dramatic car chase through the streets of Chandni Chowk. We're betting it'll either be the biggest hit of the year or the biggest disaster since "Gunda". Stay tuned!
